1.text: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:

2.text: To know wisdom and instruction; To discern the words of understanding;

3.text: To receive instruction in wise dealing, In righteousness and justice and equity;

4.text: To give prudence to the simple, To the young man knowledge and discretion:

5.text: That the wise man may hear, and increase in learning; And that the man of understanding may attain unto sound counsels:

6.text: To understand a proverb, and a figure, The words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

7.text: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of knowledge; But the foolish despise wisdom and instruction.

8.text: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, And forsake not the law of thy mother:

9.text: For they shall be a chaplet of grace unto thy head, And chains about thy neck.

10.text: My son, if sinners entice thee, Consent thou not.

11.text: If they say, Come with us, Let us lay wait for blood; Let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause;

12.text: Let us swallow them up alive as Sheol, And whole, as those that go down into the pit;

13.text: We shall find all precious substance; We shall fill our houses with spoil;

14.text: Thou shalt cast thy lot among us; We will all have one purse:

15.text: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; Refrain thy foot from their path:

16.text: For their feet run to evil, And they make haste to shed blood.

17.text: For in vain is the net spread In the sight of any bird:

18.text: And these lay wait for their own blood; They lurk privily for their own lives.

19.text: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; It taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

20.text: Wisdom crieth aloud in the street; She uttereth her voice in the broad places;

21.text: She crieth in the chief place of concourse; At the entrance of the gates, In the city, she uttereth her words:

22.text: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? And scoffers delight them in scoffing, And fools hate knowledge?

23.text: Turn you at my reproof: Behold, I will pour out my spirit upon you; I will make known my words unto you.

24.text: Because I have called, and ye have refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man hath regarded;

25.text: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, And would none of my reproof:

26.text: I also will laugh in the day of your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

27.text: When your fear cometh as a storm, And your calamity cometh on as a whirlwind; When distress and anguish come upon you.

28.text: Then will they call upon me, but I will not answer; They will seek me diligently, but they shall not find me:

29.text: For that they hated knowledge, And did not choose the fear of Jehovah:

30.text: They would none of my counsel; They despised all my reproof.

31.text: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, And be filled with their own devices.

32.text: For the backsliding of the simple shall slay them, And the careless ease of fools shall destroy them.

33.text: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell securely, And shall be quiet without fear of evil.
